alert.note: Alert for Letcher; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 8:25PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Letcher and southwestern Pike Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 825 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Potters Fork, or 10 miles northeast of Whitesburg, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Burdine around 830 PM EDT. Shelby Gap, Adamson, Dorton, Myra and Jonancy around 835 PM EDT. Ashcamp and Lookout around 845 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Rockhouse, Marrowbone, Elkhorn City, Cedarville, Belcher, Toonerville and Mouthcard. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
